The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: Everyone is entitled to their opinion\, but it breaks my heart to see so many negative reviews for this game.This is not an easy story to endure. It’s truly heartbreaking to see these characters that you’ve grown to know so well go through such pain. That being said\, I would encourage anyone who thinks this story is only about revenge to give it another try with a different lens. The way I see it\, when Ellie decides to not kill Abby\, she’s not forgiving Abby so much as she’s forgiving Joel. The fire and pain that fuels her rampage to kill Abby is not exactly fueled by Joel’s death\, but rather the pain and conflict that comes from Joel’s decision to pull her out of the hospital. Joel is a very flawed character\, and he’s certainly not a hero. If Ellie had killed Abby\, she would have been just as bad as Joel was. She loves Joel\, but she knows his death was a consequence of his actions. She doesn’t think he deserved it\, per se\, but she’s just like Abby\, trying to get revenge for her father’s death. If you can’t empathize with Abby\, I can understand why you don’t like the game\, but I would encourage you to try. I found all of the characters to be very well written and very much like real people.That’s my essay. The gameplay is also very fun and the graphics are stunning.… Expand
